name: Danish Technological Institute
goal:
The Danish Technological Institute (DTI) is an independent, non-profit institution approved by the Danish Ministry for Education and Science.
It develops, applies and disseminates research-based and technology-based knowledge to the Danish and international business sector.
The Danish Technological Institute translates knowledge into real value for society.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Research and innovation, Transport
euInitiatives:
Coordination of the Notified Bodies for the Construction Products Regulation (Regulation No. (EU) 305/2011)
Construction Products Regulation (Regulation No. (EU) 305/2011)
